    04. Estimate and correct MMs or AMCEs

    04-estimate.Rmd

    Load the projoint package 

    library(projoint)

    Read and wrangle data with the flipped repeated tasks 

    outcomes <- paste0("choice", seq(from = 1, to = 8, by = 1))
outcomes <- c(outcomes, "choice1_repeated_flipped")
out1 <- reshape_projoint(.dataframe = exampleData1, 
                         .idvar = "ResponseId", 
                         .outcomes = outcomes,
                         .outcomes_ids = c("A", "B"),
                         .alphabet = "K", 
                         .repeated = TRUE,
                         .flipped = TRUE)

    Estimate MMs

    MM (profile-level) – all levels 

    mm0 <- projoint(.data = out1,
                .qoi = NULL,
                .structure = "profile_level",
                .remove_ties = TRUE,
                .estimand = "mm",
                .se_method = "analytical",
                .irr = NULL)

mm0@estimates
    ## # A tibble: 48 × 5
##    estimand       estimate     se attribute level 
##    <chr>             <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>     <chr> 
##  1 mm_uncorrected    0.574 0.0134 att1      level1
##  2 mm_corrected      0.614 0.0207 att1      level1
##  3 mm_uncorrected    0.485 0.0134 att1      level2
##  4 mm_corrected      0.477 0.0204 att1      level2
##  5 mm_uncorrected    0.445 0.0131 att1      level3
##  6 mm_corrected      0.416 0.0203 att1      level3
##  7 mm_uncorrected    0.489 0.0133 att2      level1
##  8 mm_corrected      0.483 0.0202 att2      level1
##  9 mm_uncorrected    0.524 0.0130 att2      level2
## 10 mm_corrected      0.536 0.0200 att2      level2
## # ℹ 38 more rows

    MM (profile-level) – specific level 

    qoi_1 <- set_qoi(
  .structure = "profile_level",
  .estimand = "mm",
  .attribute = "att1", 
  .level = "level1")

mm1 <- projoint(.data = out1,
                .qoi = qoi_1,
                .structure = "profile_level",
                .estimand = "mm",
                .se_method = "analytical",
                .irr = NULL,
                .remove_ties = TRUE,
                .ignore_position = NULL,
                .n_sims = NULL,
                .n_boot = NULL)

mm1@estimates
    ## # A tibble: 2 × 5
##   estimand       estimate     se attribute level 
##   <chr>             <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>     <chr> 
## 1 mm_uncorrected    0.574 0.0134 att1      level1
## 2 mm_corrected      0.614 0.0207 att1      level1

    MM (choice-level) – specific level 

    qoi_2 <- set_qoi(
  .structure = "choice_level",
  .estimand = "mm",
  .attribute = "att1", 
  .level = c("level1", "level3")
) 

mm2 <- projoint(.data = out1,
                .qoi = qoi_2,
                .structure = "choice_level",
                .remove_ties = TRUE,
                .estimand = "mm",
                .se_method = "analytical",
                .irr = NULL,
                .ignore_position = FALSE,
                .n_sims = NULL,
                .n_boot = NULL)

mm2@estimates
    ## # A tibble: 2 × 5
##   estimand       estimate     se attribute level         
##   <chr>             <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>     <chr>         
## 1 mm_uncorrected    0.402 0.0258 att1      level1, level3
## 2 mm_corrected      0.351 0.0408 att1      level1, level3

    Estimate AMCEs

    AMCE (profile-level) – all levels 

    amce0 <- projoint(.data = out1,
                  .qoi = NULL,
                  .structure = "profile_level",
                  .remove_ties = TRUE,
                  .estimand = "amce",
                  .se_method = "analytical",
                  .irr = NULL)

amce0@estimates
    ## # A tibble: 34 × 6
##    estimand         estimate     se attribute level  baseline
##    <chr>               <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>     <chr>  <chr>   
##  1 amce_uncorrected -0.0899  0.0190 att1      level2 level1  
##  2 amce_corrected   -0.137   0.0290 att1      level2 level1  
##  3 amce_uncorrected -0.130   0.0188 att1      level3 level1  
##  4 amce_corrected   -0.198   0.0294 att1      level3 level1  
##  5 amce_uncorrected  0.0348  0.0186 att2      level2 level1  
##  6 amce_corrected    0.0530  0.0284 att2      level2 level1  
##  7 amce_uncorrected -0.00177 0.0188 att2      level3 level1  
##  8 amce_corrected   -0.00270 0.0286 att2      level3 level1  
##  9 amce_uncorrected  0.0240  0.0204 att3      level2 level1  
## 10 amce_corrected    0.0366  0.0312 att3      level2 level1  
## # ℹ 24 more rows

    AMCE (profile-level) – specific level 

    qoi_3 <- set_qoi(
  .structure = "profile_level",
  .estimand = "amce",
  .attribute = "att1", 
  .level = "level3",
  .baseline = "level1"
)

amce1 <- projoint(.data = out1,
                  .qoi = qoi_3,
                  .structure = "profile_level",
                  .remove_ties = TRUE,
                  .estimand = "amce",
                  .se_method = "analytical",
                  .irr = NULL)

amce1@estimates
    ## # A tibble: 2 × 6
##   estimand         estimate     se attribute level  baseline
##   <chr>               <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>     <chr>  <chr>   
## 1 amce_uncorrected   -0.130 0.0188 att1      level3 level1  
## 2 amce_corrected     -0.198 0.0294 att1      level3 level1

    AMCE (choice-level) – specific level 

    qoi_4 <- set_qoi(
  .structure = "choice_level",
  .estimand = "amce",
  .attribute = "att1", 
  .level = c("level1", "level3"),
  .baseline = c("level1", "level1")
)

amce2 <- projoint(.data = out1,
                  .qoi = qoi_4,
                  .structure = "choice_level",
                  .remove_ties = TRUE,
                  .estimand = "amce",
                  .se_method = "analytical",
                  .ignore_position = TRUE,
                  .irr = NULL)

amce2@estimates
    ## # A tibble: 2 × 6
##   estimand         estimate     se attribute level          baseline      
##   <chr>               <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>     <chr>          <chr>         
## 1 amce_uncorrected  -0.0168 0.0262 att1      level1, level3 level1, level1
## 2 amce_corrected    -0.0257 0.0403 att1      level1, level3 level1, level1
